column4: here's a totally newbie question... what is the difference between 386, 586, 686?
i know 386 is the old processor
and 586 is pretty much the pentiums
i just realized alot of the stuff i've been configuring has been 386, but i have a pentium 4
386 was the first intel processor that supported multitasking.. 486 was next, 586 was pentium, and Pentium II and above (including celeron) are 686
but the support for file types is not as good as mplayer, right?
i haven't had a problem with it (well, except when trying to play MOV and WMV files)
you won't find them in there..  the codecs aren't specific to totem
what do you mean? so do i have to install extra plugins for totem?
also, right now when i open an avi with totem, totem launches, but then quits right away, without displaying anything
they're like plugins.. they're called codecs
right. what's the name of these codecs?
go to the link ubotu provided
what on this wiki page should i look at?
that link should take you straight to a set of instructions on how to install all the codecs for AVIs, MPEGs, etc..
